title: Jorginho (footballer, born 1965)
text:
Jorge Luís da Silva (born 22 March 1965), commonly known as Jorginho or sometimes Jorginho Cantinflas, is a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former player who played as a <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
Career.
Jorginho played in several clubs, like <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Portuguesa%20de%20Desportos">Portuguesa</a>, <a href="Sociedade%20Esportiva%20Palmeiras">Palmeiras</a>, <a href="Coritiba%20Foot%20Ball%20Club">Coritiba</a>, <a href="Clube%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Mineiro">Atlético Mineiro</a>, <a href="Santos%20Futebol%20Clube">Santos</a>, <a href="Fluminense%20Football%20Club">Fluminense</a>.
While at Santos he scored their 10,000th goal.
Began his manager career at Palmeiras when he replace <a href="Vanderlei%20Luxemburgo">Vanderlei Luxemburgo</a> as a caretaker manager at the <a href="2009%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">2009 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A</a>.
On 5 September 2013, <a href="Clube%20N%C3%A1utico%20Capibaribe">Nautico</a> coach Jorginho resigned after just five games, all defeats, in charge of the Brazilian club.
